QR Code Link to This Post


I am a former high school math teacher with a combined 30+ years teaching and tutoring.  I have an excellent ability to explain concepts so students understand clearly.  I was a tutor for many years before teaching high school; I have a ton of experience tutoring students with all manner of learning styles.  I am patient and logical; I know how to create a comfort zone for students.

Middle school, high school, college math courses including Statistics.  Also I am well versed in the Common Core curriculum used by many schools.

I am set up to do remote tutoring if that is your preference/need.

My rate is $45 per hour.  I am not a "clock watching" tutor; if a session needs to run a bit long you will not be charged for the extra time.

References are available upon request.


David

QR Code Link to This Post


Don't wait to get a tutor! This applies to struggling students or brilliant ones, as I can help both achieve their best.



Would your student perform better in his or her subjects with a weekly tutor? I am here to help. I am a master tutor with fifteen years of experience bringing out the best of my students. I can help your student improve their English and Math skills, and maximize both learning and grades.


I earned a graduate degree from Harvard University, and I specialize adapting my teaching style to each unique student. Additionally, I have lived overseas for five years, and so I have a speciality helping students who have English as a second language (ESL). 


I can help you with the following:ENGLISH: English classes,Writing, Grammar, StyleHISTORY & OTHER LIBERAL ARTS: History, Social Studies, Government, Political Science, etc.MATH: Arithmetic, Fractions, Algebra, Geometry, TrigonometrySCIENCE: Chemistry, Biology, Physics


Individualized Tutoring
Each student is different and I listen carefully so that our sessions are most productive. There is no substitute for one-on-one tutoring.

Short Term or Long Term
Some students have stayed with me their entire high school career. Others need just a bit of help to complete a difficult assignment. 


Rates
Individualized tutoring costs $90/hr for in-person or $60/hr for online. (AT LEAST UNTIL MAY 
 2022 CORONA VIRUS PRICING: $40/hr for online weekdays.) The introductory meeting is free without any obligation. I tutor online or in-person, and I use google docs and a whiteboard program for online students. Online tutoring works very well.


NOTE: If your income has been disrupted due to the coronavirus, please indicate the hourly rate you are able to pay. 


Contact
You can text me or simply reply to this ad and we'll arrange a Zoom meeting.


kenaritutor.com

Hello All,

My name is Qusai. I have been a tutor and a teaching assistant for over 7 years. I recently graduated from UC Santa Barbara where I used to teach undergraduate students. I have taught and tutored more than 200 students and have put in more than 300 hours of teaching time. 

The most important aspect of tutoring, in my opinion, is to identify and fill in gaps in their knowledge. The last thing you want is your child having trouble with a specific concept because their foundation was shaky. I can help make sure there are no gaps in their knowledge and make sure they are performing well in school.

Some places I have taught:
- Los Angeles Pierce College
- UC Santa Barbara
- For a Company in Shanghai, China
- Private Clients in LA

Qualifications:
Undergrad: UC Berkeley
Grad: UC Santa Barbara

(Check out some of my reviews in the images attached)

If you are looking to help your child in high school or college, reach out to me. I can help break things down and get them back on track towards a positive future.

Rate: $35/hour
Online Tutoring

Note: I have all the tools for effective online tutoring including screen share and a stylus/digital white board.

Text, call, or email
- Qusai from QS Tutoring

I specializes in one-on-one tutoring for all levels of math and science. I am calm, patient and encouraging and am experienced at working with students of all ages, ranging from middle school through college. 
 My goal as tutors is to create a positive learning environment and to encourage students to be curious, ask questions and think analytically. 
Depending on scheduling and convenience, I meet students at their home, a cafe or a public library. If interested, please email me and we will devise a game plan to get you started! 
My fee is $50/h.

 Subjects:"
 * Math: middle school, high school and college level (including pre-algebra, algebra, geometry, trigonometry, pre-calculus, calculus and more)
 * Chemistry: high school and college level (including AP Chemistry)
 * Physics: high school and college level (including AP Physics)
 * SAT/ACT prep (math)
(zoom tutoring only due to COVID19)

About Me
My name is Miguel and I am currently a math and science teacher at Tilden Preparatory School in Albany. I have been working at this private school for 8 years and have 15 years of experience tutoring at community colleges, UC Berkeley Academic Service Centers, I also supervised math tutors at UC Berkeley Academic Service Centers, briefly worked at Mathnasium of Piedmont, and worked for the nonprofit organization Making Waves Education Program in Richmond CA. I have been tutoring online since 2019. I am also an online math curriculum developer and webmaster for the educational website Math Fortress. I also speak fluent Spanish.

Tutoring Locations
I live in Albany and I am available to tutor in-person around the East Bay. I am also available for online tutoring sessions upon request. I can meet at a nearby cafe, library, or at home.

Rates
My rate is $110/hour for in-person tutoring sessions near Albany, CA. My rate increases the further I need to travel. If you can meet me as close as possible to Albany, CA I do not mind charging this rate.

My rate is $80/hour for online tutoring via Zoom, Skype, or Google Hangouts. You will need a good internet connection, working microphone, and working speakers at the minimum. We will be using an interactive online whiteboard during our online session. Discounts available for recurring online sessions.

Tutoring Subjects
I can teach/tutor Math, Physics, and Chemistry so it's like having 3 tutors in one. I am available to tutor and provide support in the following courses:

[Math]
Algebra 1 (Beginning), 2 (Intermediate)
College Algebra
Geometry
Precalculus
AP Calculus: AB and BC
Calculus I: Differential Calculus
Calculus II: Integral Calculus
Calculus III: Multivariable Calculus
SAT: Math Only*
ACT: Math Only*
SAT Subject: Mathematics Level 1 and 2
Common Core: Math 1, Math 2, Math 3

[Science]
Chemistry
AP Chemistry
College General Chemistry
Physics
AP Physics 1 and 2
AP Physics C: Mechanics
AP Physics C: Electricity & Magnetism
College General Physics
College Physics for Scientists and Engineers

Scheduling An Appointment

Hi, my name is Alexander Blake, and I have been tutoring for over 9,000 hours! I graduated with a Bachelor's in Computer Science from California State University, Fullerton. In my time tutoring, I have tutored elementary through graduate level students.
I have successfully prepared students for SAT and ACT Math tests, and up to Calculus level work. In high school, I was in an accelerated math program where I was able to take AP Calculus AB my junior year, and AP Calculus BC my senior year. After taking the AP Calculus AB & BC Exams, I scored a 5 out of 5 on both tests. This allowed me to not only begin my higher-level math courses early in college but has also enabled me to keep my math skills refined, and graduate with a 3.8 GPA.
My tutoring philosophy focuses on the individual. I like to know what each of my clients likes to do outside of school so I can relate the math concepts they are learning about things they enjoy doing. To accomplish this, I personally design my lesson plans and customize them to my client's personality. For example, if I have a student that plays basketball, I will have them solve problems that incorporate concepts of basketball, such as finding a team's field goal percentage. By focusing on each person uniquely, I am able to fully understand why the student is not grasping certain concepts and can help them understand concepts and terms they are already familiar with. This is why all of my students have been and will continue to be successful!

--MY ADVICE TO PARENTS--

1. hire A YOUNG TUTOR that is a STUDENT.

Since I am a student myself and fairly young, students feel comfortable with me and I am able to earn their trust. This is very important bc most students are embarrassed or shy to ask for help.

2. DO NOT PAY MORE THAN $60/HR For HIGH SCHOOL level math or below

I offer negotiable pricing bc I care for my students and their families, unlike most tutoring agencies or overpriced tutors. Since, I never had a student that did not do well, it is important for me to continue this legacy and not let price affect the students academic success. As a result, I work with families to establish appropriate rates so that we see student improvement and progress.

Most of my students meet with me 2x a week or more. Each session is 2 hours long, 1 hour for content review. 1 hour for practice problems/application of the material. I have been doing this for over 15 years and I have seen little progress in students that meet with me only 1 hour a week; therefore, I no longer offer that option.

There is always something to do, whether its make-up work, exam preparation, or homework. It is crucial for the student to feel accountable, therefore, I strongly recommend scheduling a consistent meeting every week and not canceling last minute bc the student doesn't have homework. Like I said there is always something that needs to be done, and students are all very behind now due to remote learning, however, the expectations from teachers have not changed. As a result, I enforce a 24-hour cancellation policy to keep scheduling times fair for all students. 



3. DO NOT HIRE MEDICAL STUDENTS/ PHD GRADUATES or any tutor that has a job or is in a rigorous academic program

Why? They already have a lot on their plate which. means that they are

1. difficult to get a hold of
2. unreliable with the scheduling
3. low flexibility with tutoring times
4. unfamiliar with the curriculum since they haven't seen it for so many years and even if they have they most likely were educated outside of CA- which leads to more confusion for the student. I have had many students who complain about how their prior tutor would teach them different things then they were learning in class. Most of the time, this was information they didn't even need. 



Since I have grown up in the California/ Bay Area school districts, have kept a consistent 4.0 grade average, and have been tutoring math/science since my sophomore year in high school, I have a pretty strong recollection of the curriculum your child is learning and I always make sure I am teaching them the material their teacher is teaching in a way that they understand. 

Also, I am very flexible with scheduling since my relationship with my mentor is well established and in a manner that gives me great independence over my schedule. So I can have time to meet at the same / time / day of the week.

4. find ONLY ONE TUTOR for ALL SUBJECTS needed

why? this will make your life a whole lot easier bc you are communicating payment/ scheduling etc with ONLY 1 person.

I tutor all subjects but in addition to this I also empower the student to learn how to study, stay organized, plan effectively, gain motivation etc --all factors important to being a successful student now and into the future. Therefore, I am more of a mentor than a tutor.

I offer tutoring for math, in all levels from middle school, high school, through college, including: Pre-Algebra, Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Pre-calculus, Calculus including AP Calculus AB/BC up through Calculus 3 and Linear Algebra. I've been tutoring one-on-one since 2016. 

I feel deeply about empowering people to their highest capacities, and I feel a lot of compassion for people who are held back by what they think they can’t do. Many people struggle with math, and get stuck in frustration and overwhelm. I pay careful attention to what each student needs, and investigate what is stuck in the whole process of learning.

My specialty is bringing research from psychology and mindfulness to teaching. What a student needs is often more feedback from and assistance from a tutor, but often what's most important is looking at the emotional, psychological, and cognitive aspects of learning. I will also often work on test taking skills, and help students work with anxiety around testing.

When I'm working with students on math, of course, I always prioritize conceptual clarity and fluency. I look for what concepts are missing in a student's understanding, and break down all the pieces necessary to build up each new concept.

Currently I offer tutoring in person if vaccinated, as well as virtually over zoom. My rate is $50/hr, negotiable according to circumstances and the number of hours per week.

Please contact me via email (see the craigslist reply button).
